verses.verse: I said<WH559> to myself,<WH3820> "Come<WH1980> now,<WH4994> I will test<WH5254> you with pleasure.<WH8057> So enjoy<WH7200> <WH9185> yourself." And behold,<WH2009> it too<WH1571> was futility.<WH1892>
I said<WH559> of laughter,<WH7814> "It is madness,<WH1984>" and of pleasure,<WH8057> "What<WH4100> does it accomplish<WH6213>?"

I explored<WH8446> with my mind<WH3820> [how] to stimulate<WH4900> my body<WH1320> with wine<WH3196> while my mind<WH3820> was guiding<WH5090> [me] wisely,<WH2451> and how to take<WH270> hold<WH270> of folly,<WH5531> until<WH5704> <WH834> I could see<WH7200> what<WH335> <WH2088> good<WH2896> there is for the sons<WH1121> of men<WH120> to do<WH6213> under<WH8478> heaven<WH8064> the few<WH4557> years<WH3117> of their lives.<WH9132>
I enlarged<WH1431> my works:<WH4639> I built<WH1129> houses<WH1004> for myself, I planted<WH5193> vineyards<WH3754> for myself;
I made<WH6213> gardens<WH1593> and parks<WH6508> for myself, and I planted<WH5193> in them all<WH3605> kinds of fruit<WH6529> trees;<WH6086>
I made<WH6213> ponds<WH1295> of water<WH4325> for myself from which to irrigate<WH8248> a forest<WH9194> of growing<WH6779> trees.<WH6086>

I bought<WH7069> male<WH5650> and female<WH8198> slaves,<WH8198> <WH5650> and I had<WH1961> homeborn<WH1121> <WH1004> slaves.<WH1121> Also<WH1571> I possessed flocks<WH6629> and herds<WH1241> larger<WH7235> than<WH4480> all<WH3605> who<WH7945> preceded<WH6440> me in Jerusalem.<WH3389>

Also,<WH1571> I collected<WH3664> for myself silver<WH3701> and gold,<WH2091> and the treasure<WH5459> of kings<WH4428> and provinces.<WH4082> I provided<WH6213> for myself male and female singers<WH7891> and the pleasures<WH8588> of men<WH1121> <WH120> â€“ many<WH7705> concubines.<WH7705>

Then I became<WH1431> great<WH1431> and increased<WH3254> more<WH4480> than<WH4480> all<WH3605> who<WH7945> preceded<WH6440> me in Jerusalem.<WH3389> My wisdom<WH2451> also<WH637> stood<WH5975> by me.

And all<WH3605> that my eyes<WH5869> desired<WH7592> I did not refuse<WH680> them. I did not withhold<WH4513> my heart<WH3820> from any<WH3605> pleasure,<WH8057> for my heart<WH3820> was pleased<WH8056> because<WH4480> of all<WH3605> my labor<WH5999> and this<WH2088> was my reward<WH2506> for all<WH3605> my labor.<WH5999>

Thus I considered<WH6437> all<WH3605> my activities<WH4639> which<WH7945> my hands<WH3027> had done<WH6213> and the labor<WH5999> which<WH7945> I had exerted,<WH6213> and behold<WH2009> all<WH3605> was vanity<WH1892> and striving<WH7469> after wind<WH7307> and there<WH369> was no<WH369> profit<WH3504> under<WH8478> the sun.<WH8121>

So I turned<WH6437> to consider<WH7200> wisdom,<WH2451> madness<WH1947> and folly,<WH5531> for what<WH4100> [will] the man<WH120> [do] who<WH7945> will come<WH935> after<WH310> the king<WH4428> [except] what<WH834> has already<WH3528> been done<WH6213>?
And I saw<WH7200> that wisdom<WH2451> excels<WH3504> folly<WH5531> as light<WH216> excels<WH3504> darkness.<WH2822>

The wise<WH2450> man's eyes<WH5869> are in his head,<WH7218> but the fool<WH3684> walks<WH1980> in darkness.<WH2822> And yet<WH1571> I know<WH3045> that one<WH259> fate<WH4745> befalls<WH7136> them both.<WH3605>

Then I said<WH559> to myself,<WH3820> "As is the fate<WH4745> of the fool,<WH3684> it will also<WH1571> befall<WH7136> me. Why<WH4100> then<WH227> have I been<WH2449> extremely<WH3148> wise<WH2449>?" So I said<WH1696> to myself,<WH3820> "This<WH2088> too<WH1571> is vanity.<WH1892>"

For there<WH369> is no<WH369> lasting<WH5769> remembrance<WH2146> of the wise<WH2450> man<WH2450> [as] with the fool,<WH3684> inasmuch<WH7945> as [in] the coming<WH935> days<WH3117> all<WH3605> will be forgotten.<WH7911> And how<WH349> the wise<WH2450> man<WH2450> and the fool<WH3684> alike<WH5973> die!<WH4191>

So I hated<WH8130> life,<WH9132> for the work<WH4639> which<WH7945> had been done<WH6213> under<WH8478> the sun<WH8121> was grievous<WH7451> to me; because<WH3588> everything<WH3605> is futility<WH1892> and striving<WH7469> after wind.<WH7307>

Thus I hated<WH8130> all<WH3605> the fruit<WH5999> of my labor<WH5999> for which<WH7945> I had labored<WH6001> under<WH8478> the sun,<WH8121> for I must leave<WH5117> it to the man<WH120> who<WH7945> will come<WH1961> after<WH310> me.

And who<WH4310> knows<WH3045> whether he will be a wise<WH2450> man<WH2450> or<WH176> a fool<WH5530>? Yet he will have control<WH7980> over<WH7980> all<WH3605> the fruit<WH5999> of my labor<WH5999> for which<WH7945> I have labored<WH5998> by acting<WH2449> wisely<WH2449> under<WH8478> the sun.<WH8121> This<WH2088> too<WH1571> is vanity.<WH1892>
Therefore I completely<WH5437> <WH3820> despaired<WH2976> of all<WH3605> the fruit<WH5999> of my labor<WH5999> for which<WH7945> I had labored<WH5998> under<WH8478> the sun.<WH8121>

When<WH3588> there<WH3426> is a man<WH120> who<WH7945> has labored<WH5998> with wisdom,<WH2451> knowledge<WH1847> and skill,<WH3788> then he gives<WH5414> his legacy<WH2506> to one<WH120> who<WH7945> has not labored<WH5998> with them. This<WH2088> too<WH1571> is vanity<WH1892> and a great<WH7227> evil.<WH9567>
For what<WH4100> does a man<WH120> get<WH1933> in all<WH3605> his labor<WH5999> and in his striving<WH7475> with which<WH7945> he labors<WH6001> under<WH8478> the sun<WH8121>?

Because<WH3588> all<WH3605> his days<WH3117> his task<WH6045> is painful<WH4341> and grievous;<WH3708> even<WH1571> at night<WH3915> his mind<WH3820> does not rest.<WH7901> This<WH2088> too<WH1571> is vanity.<WH1892>

There<WH369> is nothing<WH369> better<WH2896> for a man<WH120> [than] to eat<WH398> and drink<WH8354> and tell<WH7200> himself<WH5315> that his labor<WH5999> is good.<WH9185> This<WH2090> also<WH1571> I have seen,<WH7200> that it is from the hand<WH3027> of God.<WH430>
For who<WH4310> can eat<WH398> and who<WH4310> can have<WH9126> enjoyment<WH9126> without<WH2351> <WH4480> Him?

For to a person<WH120> who<WH7945> is good<WH2896> in His sight<WH6440> He has given<WH5414> wisdom<WH2451> and knowledge<WH1847> and joy,<WH8057> while to the sinner<WH2398> He has given<WH5414> the task<WH6045> of gathering<WH622> and collecting<WH3664> so that he may give<WH5414> to one<WH2896> who<WH2896> is good<WH2896> in God's sight.<WH6440> This<WH2088> too<WH1571> is vanity<WH1892> and striving<WH7469> after wind.<WH7307>
